content.metaTitle: Living in Villamartin | Golf Properties Costa Blanca South 2026
content.metaDescription: Complete guide to Villamartin, the golf capital of Costa Blanca South. Properties from €185k, 5 courses within 15 minutes, famous plaza, thriving expat community.
content.quickAnswer: Villamartin is the golf capital of Costa Blanca South, built around the famous Villamartin Golf Club (est. 1972). Properties range from €185,000 apartments to €750,000 villas, with 5 championship courses within 15 minutes. The famous Villamartin Plaza is the social heart of the expat community.
content.heroIntro:
There's a moment every morning in Villamartin when the sun hits the first fairway, the sprinklers dance across manicured greens, and the early groups appear on the horizon. This isn't just a place where people play golf—it's a place built entirely around the game.

Villamartin was created in the early 1970s with a vision that was ahead of its time: design a community where golf is woven into the fabric of daily life. Half a century later, that vision has matured into one of Costa Blanca's most desirable addresses. The championship course that gives the area its name is surrounded by low-rise villas, townhouses, and apartments, many with direct fairway views. The famous Villamartin Plaza buzzes with life every evening, its restaurants and bars the gathering point for a community that spans dozens of nationalities.

lifestyleSection.intro:
Living in Villamartin means golf is always within reach, but life here is about far more than the game. The Plaza is the social epicenter—a purpose-built square surrounded by restaurants, bars, and cafés where the community gathers every evening. On any given night, you'll hear a dozen languages, though English predominates. Friendships form quickly here.

The day typically starts with coffee at your favorite terrace, perhaps a round at one of the five courses within 15 minutes, lunch at the clubhouse, and evenings back at the Plaza watching the world go by. It's a rhythm that attracts retirees, remote workers, and anyone who dreamed of making golf a lifestyle rather than a hobby.

amenitiesSection.beaches: Villamartin is inland but beaches are just 10 minutes away. La Zenia Beach offers Blue Flag golden sands with full facilities—lifeguards, beach bars, sun loungers. Playa Flamenca is ideal for families with calm, shallow waters. For something special, the rocky coves of Cabo Roig provide crystal-clear snorkeling and fresh seafood at the harbor.
amenitiesSection.dining: The Villamartin Plaza is famous for its restaurant scene—Spanish tapas, British pubs, Italian trattorias, and everything in between. The golf club offers excellent dining with views over the course. For variety, La Zenia Boulevard (3 km) has 30+ restaurants, and Cabo Roig's harbor serves the freshest seafood on the coast.
amenitiesSection.shopping: Daily essentials are available at local supermarkets within Villamartin. For serious shopping, La Zenia Boulevard is just 3 km away—over 150 stores including Primark, Zara, Media Markt, and a large Mercadona. The Wednesday market at the Plaza offers fresh produce and local goods.
amenitiesSection.healthcare: Hospital Universitario de Torrevieja is 12 km away (15 minutes), with comprehensive services and English-speaking staff. Several private clinics and dentists serve the Villamartin area, many with English-speaking practitioners. Multiple 24-hour pharmacies are nearby. The large expat community means healthcare services are well-adapted to international patients.
amenitiesSection.transport: Alicante-Elche Airport is 55 km away (40 minutes via AP-7 motorway). Murcia-Corvera Airport is 35 km (30 minutes). A car is recommended for Villamartin—while many amenities are within walking distance of the Plaza, beaches and shopping require transport. Taxis are readily available, and the expat community often organizes car-sharing.

content.propertyMarketSection:
Villamartin offers strong value for golf-focused living. New build apartments start from around €185,000-250,000, townhouses from €250,000-400,000, and villas from €400,000-750,000. Golf-view properties command premiums of 15-25% but offer genuine lifestyle value and rental income potential.

**Featured Development: La Vista Boulevard** – Modern 3-bed villas from €489,900 with private pools, near Villamartin Golf. Contemporary design with solarium, garage, and high-spec finishes.

The rental market is particularly strong—golf tourists seek Villamartin year-round, especially during spring and autumn when European courses are closed. Properties with pools, golf views, and walking distance to the Plaza achieve occupancy rates exceeding 70% annually.

Resale properties offer excellent value for those seeking immediate occupation or larger plots. The established community and mature gardens make resales attractive for permanent residents.

faqs.question: Is Villamartin good for golf?
faqs.answer: Villamartin is arguably the best golf location on Costa Blanca South. Five championship courses are within 15 minutes: Villamartin Golf (0 km), Las Ramblas (2 km), Campoamor (4 km), Las Colinas (8 km), and Vistabella (12 km). The year-round climate allows golf 365 days a year.

faqs.question: What is the Villamartin Plaza?
faqs.answer: Villamartin Plaza is the famous social hub of the community—a purpose-built square surrounded by restaurants, bars, and cafés. It's where the international community gathers every evening, with dozens of dining options and a buzzing atmosphere year-round. It's the heart of expat social life in Orihuela Costa.

faqs.question: How far is Villamartin from the beach?
faqs.answer: Blue Flag beaches are about 5 km away (10 minutes drive). La Zenia Beach is closest with full facilities. Playa Flamenca and Cabo Roig's rocky coves are also within easy reach. Many residents prefer the inland lifestyle during the week and beach days on weekends.

faqs.question: What are property prices in Villamartin?
faqs.answer: New build apartments start from around €185,000, townhouses from €250,000, and villas from €400,000. Golf-view properties command 15-25% premiums. Resales can offer better value for immediate occupation. Overall, Villamartin offers excellent value compared to equivalent golf communities.

faqs.question: Is Villamartin good for rental investment?
faqs.answer: Yes, Villamartin has strong rental potential. Golf tourists seek the area year-round, especially spring and autumn when European courses close. Properties with pools, golf views, and Plaza access achieve 70%+ annual occupancy. The combination of golf, shopping, and beaches creates diverse demand.

faqs.question: Is English widely spoken in Villamartin?
faqs.answer: English is the predominant language in Villamartin due to the large British expat community. Most businesses, restaurants, and services cater to English speakers. Many are British-owned. You can live comfortably without Spanish, though learning some enriches the experience.

faqs.question: What nationalities live in Villamartin?
faqs.answer: Villamartin has a diverse international community with British residents historically predominant. Scandinavians (Swedish, Norwegian, Danish), Dutch, Belgian, Irish, and German residents are increasingly common. The Plaza hosts a cosmopolitan mix on any evening.

faqs.question: How far is Villamartin from Alicante Airport?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is approximately 55 km from Villamartin, taking around 40 minutes via the AP-7 motorway. Murcia-Corvera Airport is closer at 35 km (30 minutes), offering additional flight options particularly with Ryanair.

faqs.question: What is daily life like in Villamartin?
faqs.answer: A typical day: morning coffee on your terrace, perhaps a round of golf, lunch at the clubhouse or a Plaza restaurant, afternoon siesta or pool time, then evening drinks and dinner at the Plaza. The community is social and welcoming—making friends is easy if you participate.

faqs.question: Is Villamartin suitable for permanent living?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Unlike some resort areas, Villamartin has a large permanent resident population. Services operate year-round, the community is active in all seasons, and mild winters (16-18°C average) make outdoor living possible throughout the year. Many residents live here full-time.

content.conclusion:
Villamartin offers something rare: a genuine golf lifestyle community with proven appeal and excellent value. Whether you're seeking a holiday home with rental income, a retirement paradise, or simply a place where golf is woven into daily life, Villamartin delivers. The Plaza, the courses, the community—they've been welcoming newcomers for fifty years.
